alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wichita and Greeley Counties through 645 PM MDT/745 PM CDT/... At 602 PM MDT/702 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Hartman to 12 miles north of Syracuse. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...At 6 PM MDT, the Tribune airport reported a 53 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Wichita and Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Lydia, Marienthal and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT/1100 PM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
